Title: Emotion classification based on public opinion analysis on online news
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ciptadi, Computer Science Department, BINUS, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., Computer Science Department, BINUS, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Technological developments, especially on social media, allow online news readers to channel their opinions in the form of comments and reactions. Opinions given by readers are a great source of data that can be processed for the emotions of readers. This paper intends to classify emotions by comparing two classifiers, namely Naive Bayes and Logistic Regression. The dataset used in this study was taken f rom Indonesian online news detik.com which has eight class emotion. This study has several experimental scenarios that is a combination of total comment and ratio. Because of the imbalance class data, this study uses the SMOTE oversampling technique. This study also shows that the use of SMOTE oversampling can improve classifier performance. The results of this study show that the accuracy achieved 55.43% for the Naive Bayes classifier and 65.95% for the Logistic Regression classifier after SMOTE. It can increase the accuracy up to 35%. © 2019, International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Emotion classification; Indonesian news; Reader emotion; Smote oversampling
